conclusion: The particle is negatively charged with charge q, mass m.
It moves through an electric field between plates MN and PQ, and a magnetic field within square abcd.
The electric field between the plates is uniform.
The magnetic field within the square is uniform, directed into the plane, with strength B.
The particle moves in a straight line between the plates, indicating the forces due to the electric field and the magnetic field are balanced.
The force due to the electric field is Fe = qE.
The force due to the magnetic field is Fm = qvB.
Since the particle moves in a straight line, these forces are equal: qE = qvB, thus E = vB.
The particle exits the magnetic field just touching side cd, implying a circular path with radius 2L.
The centripetal force required for circular motion is provided by the magnetic force: mv^2/r = qvB.
The magnitude of the velocity v of the particle when it is injected at point S is v = 2LqB/m.
